text: Justine Henin (born June 1, 1982 in Liège) is a Belgian former professional tennis player and a World Number 1. She won seven Grand Slam singles titles, including four (and three in a row) at the French Open. She is two-time runner up at Wimbledon but never won the title. Her mental toughness and her one- handed backhand are recognized by great tennis players. One of the greatest tennis player of all time, Billie Jean King has said that Justine is the best player of her generation. She was known as Justine Henin-Hardenne for a while, until she separated from her husband in 2007 and went back to her maiden name of Justine Henin. She retired in 2008 but announced her comeback on 22 September after seeing the success of her compatriot Kim Clijsters. ==Related pages== * List of WTA number 1 ranked players Category:1982 births Category:Belgian tennis players Category:Female tennis players Category:French Open champions Category:Living people Category:Medalists at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Liège Category:US Open (tennis) champions Category:World No. 1 tennis players
